articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visits Bier of Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visits Bier of Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Monday visited the bier of Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and first vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK, to express deep condolences over his death. 
					 Visiting the bier together with him were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK and chief of the KPA General Staff, who are members of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK, vice-chairman of the NDC and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Kuk Thae, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Control Commission of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok and Hong Sok Hyong, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Ri Yong Mu, member of the Political Bureau of the C.
					
					 C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Ju Sang Song, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and minister of People's Security, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Jong Gak, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and first vice-director of the KPA General Political Bureau, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Thae Jong Su and Kim Phyong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Ri Thae Nam, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Pak Jong Sun, alternate member of the Political Bureau and first vi
					
					 ce department director of the C.C., the WPK, U Tong Chuk, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and member of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, O Kuk Ryol, vice-chairman of the NDC, Paek Se Bong, member of the NDC, and Kim Myong Guk, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol and Yun Jong Rin, members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK.
					
					 Seen standing before the bier of the late Jo Myong Rok was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Placed there were wreaths sent by the WPK Central Committee, the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, the DPRK Cabinet and the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces.
					
					 Amid the playing of a dirge, Kim Jong Il observed a moment's silence in memory of the deceased. And he looked round the bier with bitter sorrow over the loss of the dearest revolutionary comrade-in-arms and revolutionary comrade.
					
					 Then, he met the bereaved families of the deceased and expressed profound condolences to them and warmly consoled them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Monday sent a wreath to the bier of KPA Vice Marshal Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee, first vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Deep Condolences Expressed over Death of Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Deep Condolences Expressed over Death of Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Leading officials of the state and armed forces organs Monday visited the bier of Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, first vice-chairman of the National Defense Commission of the DPRK and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly, to express deep condolences over his death.
					  Seen standing before the bier of the late Jo Myong Rok was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Also seen standing before the bier were wreaths sent by the C.C., the WPK, the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the NDC of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, the DPRK Cabinet and the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces.
					
					 Among the mourners were Choe Yong Rim, Jon Pyong Ho, Pyon Yong Rip, Kim Rak Hui, Kim Chang Sop, Ri Ha Il, anti-Japanese veteran fighters Ri Ul Sol and Kim Chol Man, and Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party, and Ryu Mi Yong, chairperson of the C.C., the Chondoist Chongu Party.
					
					 They observed a moment's silence in memory of the late Jo Myong Rok and expressed deep condolences to the bereaved families of the deceased. 
					
					 On the same day officials of armed forces organs including the NDC and the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, servicepersons of KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials of the party and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, working people from all walks of life, the diplomatic corps and the military attaches corps here and overseas Koreans visited the Central Hall of Workers where the bier of the deceased was placed and expressed condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Mayor of Khabarovsk
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Mayor of Khabarovsk
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Aleksandr Sokolov, mayor of Khabarovsk of Russia, and his party Monday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					 The mayor referred to the fact that he saw the Korean people having achieved shining successes in building a rich and powerful country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people rallied close around Kim Jong Il would make greater progress in the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: Gift from Mayor of Khabarovsk
articles.content:
Gift from Mayor of Khabarovsk
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the mayor of Khabarovsk of Russia now on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was handed over to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by Mayor Aleksandr Sokolov on Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Tours Liaoning Province
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Tours Liaoning Province
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and his party, on an unofficial working visit to Northeast China, visited various places in Shenyang City and Dalian City, Liaoning Province,.
					 They paid visits to the Shenyang Blower Co., Ltd., the Dalian Locomotive Production Company, the Dalian Bingshan Group, the Liaoning Fishery Group, an ancient historic site Beiling Park and other places which General Secretary Kim Jong Il had visited last May.
					
					 Meanwhile, Choe Yong Rim met and had a friendly talk with Wang Min, secretary of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China, and Chen Zhenggao, governor of the Liaoning Provincial People's Government.
					
					 While staying there the premier and his party were entertained to the banquets jointly given by the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the CPC and the Liaoning Provincial People's Government, the Shenyang City Committee and the Dalian City Committee of the CPC and the relevant people's governments.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Cambodia
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message noted that after the independence the Cambodian people have made ceaseless efforts for the sovereignty of the country and the prosperity of the nation and in this course they could bring about the socio-political stability and the rapid economic development.
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries which were provided by President Kim Il Sung together with Great King Norodom Sihanouk will continue to develop further, the message sincerely wished the king greater successes in his noble work.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Prime Minister of Cambodia
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Prime Minister of Cambodia
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a message of greetings to Hun Sen, prime minister of the Cambodian government, on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will continue to develop, the message wished the prime minister greater successes in his responsible work for the development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, also sent a similar message to Hor Nam Hong, deputy prime minister who doubles as minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of the Cambodian government, on the same day.

articles.title: Congratulations to Tanzanian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Tanzanian President
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete on his reelection as president of Tanzania.  
					 The message said that the Korean people rejoice over the fact that the friendly Tanzanian people have achieved progress and development in social and economic fields under the correct leadership of the president.
					
					 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message wished him fresh success in his work for the prosperity of the country and welfare of its people.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Kim Il Sung University led by President Song Ja Rip left here today to attend the Asian Forum of University Presidents to be held in Guangzhou of China. Also leaving was a delegation of Kim Chaek University of Technology led by President Hong So Hon to visit Dongbei University of China.
					 Meanwhile, arriving here that day were a delegation of the Ho Chi Minh National Academy of Politics and Public Administration headed by President Le Huu Nghia, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, and a delegation of the Finnish Foreign Ministry led by Ambassador Pasi Patokallio.

articles.title: Animal Medicinal Materials Newly Developed
articles.content:
Animal Medicinal Materials Newly Developed
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Zoologists of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have made success in developing Koryo medicines with some ingredients of animals.
					 Scientists of the Zoology Research Institute under the State Academy of Sciences have made medicines efficacious for convulsions with useful elements extracted from toad, scorpion, large spider and other animals.
					
					 In particular, they have found out some 20 kinds of usefulness in venom of pit viper and proved their utility for raw materials of injections and pills for thyroiditis and surgical treatment.
					
					 They have also used bile of pit viper in making Asdofell Injection for liver cirrhosis and dropsy, rheumatism, bronchial asthma and indigestion. 
					
					 The injection promotes the composition of nucleic acid and protein in human body and enhances the activity of various enzymes to properly adjust functions of all organs, including immunity.
					
					 It also promotes regeneration and multiplication of cells, secretion and excretion of bile in liver, liver function and urination and prevents inflammation.
					
					 The institute has developed a technology of simultaneously separating major ingredients from snake to mass-produce medicines for thrombus, cancer, hypertension and other diseases.
					
					 Koryo medicines manufactured with venom of animals have already been used in hospitals.

articles.title: Building-materials Factories Contribute to Construction in Capital
articles.content:
Building-materials Factories Contribute to Construction in Capital
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Building-materials factories in Pyongyang have produced equipment and materials enough for the construction of 100,000 housing units in the capital and the improvement of the people's living. 
					 The Taesong Ceramic Factory, which has already fulfilled its yearly plan, is keeping the equipment at full capacity to attain a record high in the production of such good-quality materials as tiles and sanitary wares. 
					
					 The factory has made new burning equipment by itself through a technological innovation effort. 
					
					 The Pyongyang Metal Building-materials Factory, with the help of the Three-revolution Team members, has introduced latest science and technologies in production to boost the output of various building-materials needed for dwelling houses. 
					
					 The Pyongyang Chemical Building-materials Factory has sharply increased the production of quality roofing tiles and coating materials by fully exploiting its own reserves. 
					
					 Increased production has also been reported from other building-materials factories in the city, including the Pyongyang Plastic Building-materials Factory.

articles.title: New Varieties of Cosmetics Developed
articles.content:
New Varieties of Cosmetics Developed
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory has succeeded in developing new varieties of functional cosmetics.
					 They include hair-coloring cream which makes hair glossy and silky, cleansing cream good for preventing skin contamination and protecting skin from UV rays and refreshing wormwood shampoo and conditioner good for preventing aging and vitalizing immune activities.
					
					 The factory has also channeled efforts into putting the production of new products on a normal footing.
					
					 A signal boost has been made in the production of varieties of cosmetics including enzymatic toothpaste, sulfur mud soap and chitinous acid foundation cream strong in antibiosis and resistance against UV, cosmetics manufactured last year by use of natural biological materials.

articles.title: What Does Japan Seek through Its Trumpeting about "Threat"?
articles.content:
What Does Japan Seek through Its Trumpeting about "Threat"?
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan at a recent parade of the Ground "Self-Defense Force" underscored the "necessity to get ready for effectively coping with various situations", making a hue and cry over "threats" from the DPRK and China.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 Lurking behind Japan's trumpeting about fictitious "threat" from someone is a dangerous ulterior intention to put further spurs to its moves to turn it into a military giant and launch reinvasion which it has long stepped up.
					
					 The recent outbursts let loose by the chief executive of Japan are no more than a continuation of his stereotyped ballyhooing about "threats."
					
					 As far as the issue of threats is concerned, the DPRK and other countries around Japan have the right to complain about threats.
					
					 Japan is chiefly to blame in every respect for the existing Cold War-style confrontation structure and the increasing threat in Northeast Asia.
					
					 By his call for "getting ready to effectively cope with various situations" the chief executive of Japan meant easing the "three principles of arms export." Japan's attempt to let its "Self-Defense Forces" have the same task capability as the U.S. Marines' can be interpreted as part of the above-said "preparations." The Japanese authorities are noisily trumpeting about "threats" from the DPRK and other countries around Japan in a bid to justify their dangerous moves to turn it into a military power and launch reinvasion.
					
					 No one in the world would be taken in by their noisy trumpeting about "threats".
					
					 This will only bring Japan's true colors as a dangerous aggression force and war state into bolder relief.

articles.title: S. Korean Warlike Forces Accused of Recklessly Escalating Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Warlike Forces Accused of Recklessly Escalating Confrontation
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean authorities formally joined the U.S.-created PSI experts steering group. Earlier, the puppet Ministry of Defense, hinting at the active participation in the missile defense system, announced that it would confer with the U.S. on the "intelligence sharing and use of means" concerning the MD to cope with "threats of nukes and WMDs" from someone.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: 
					
					 The above-said moves are deliberate provocative acts of the ultra-right conservative group to chill the atmosphere of the process for improving the north-south relations unanimously desired by all the Koreans and push the situation to the extreme phase of military confrontation.
					
					 The ultra-right conservative group of south Korea, afraid of the moves to improve the inter-Korean relations, is making desperate efforts to stir up the atmosphere of confrontation and escalate the tension behind the scene of dialogue.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' above-mentioned moves cannot be construed otherwise than deliberate and premeditated moves to threaten the DPRK by force and, furthermore, scuttle the north-south dialogue and cooperation in collusion with outsiders. The more desperately the south Korean ruling forces push the situation to the extreme phase of confrontation, talking about fictitious "threat" from someone, the more glaringly they will reveal their despicable true colors as disturbers of dialogue and peace.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to stop running amuck, pondering over what serious consequences their reckless escalation of confrontation quite contrary to the trend of the process to improve the inter-Korean relations will entail.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Reconciliation and Cooperation Called for
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Reconciliation and Cooperation Called for
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The reconciliation and cooperation between the north and the south of Korea are a prerequisite to promoting the national unity and bringing earlier the independent reunification, peace and prosperity.
					 Rodong Sinmun today says this in a by-lined article.
					
					 What is important in realizing the reconciliation and cooperation of the Korean nation divided into the north and the south is for both sides to settle all problems on the basis of the idea of "By our nation itself", the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The truthfulness and vitality of the said idea for national independence and unity were fully displayed through the practices in the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 However, the on-going dialogue between the north and the south has not born tangible fruit owing to their fundamental difference in stance and attitude towards the dialogue.
					
					 If the south side keeps approaching the dialogue from the present wrong stand, the inter-Korean dialogue will drag on without any good fruition and, in the long run, bring disappointment only to the fellow countrymen as it did last year.
					
					 The reality eloquently shows who is the anti-reunification force that holds monopoly over the north-south dialogue, chills the atmosphere of national reconciliation and cooperation and persistently hinders the improvement of the inter-Korean relations, only pursuant to the interests of a tiny handful of ultra-right conservatives with indifference to the common interests of the nation.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities are truly willing to improve the north-south relations and achieve independent reunification, they should stop standing in the way of reconciliation and cooperation under the absurd conditions and pretext.

articles.title: Struggle against Repression Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle against Repression Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Students Committee of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea on November 3 made public an appeal calling upon all the democratic forces to turn out in the struggle against the puppet authorities' suppression. 
					Noting that the present "government" enacted a special law on mobilizing the police and the armed forces to mercilessly quell rallies and demonstrations of people under the pretext of an international meeting, the appeal branded it as a declaration of martial law on the people. 
					
					Nowadays the authorities are conducting illegal inspection on civilians, detention of members of progressive organizations and searches everyday and those committing suicides in protest against the suppression are increasing in number, it pointed out.
					
					It charged that the authorities are seeking renegotiations for conclusion of the humiliating "Free Trade Agreement" with the United States, regardless of the people's livelihood.
					
					Due to the dictatorial rule of the authorities the democratization of society has been mercilessly violated and the sufferings of the people are growing severer, the appeal said, adding that the "government's" unpopular behavior can not be allowed any longer. 
					
					It stressed that all the people should turn out in the struggle against the authorities' suppression so as to realize the democratization of society and achieve the right to existence.

articles.title: Falsity of "Results of Investigation" into "Cheonan" Case Exposed Again
articles.content:
Falsity of "Results of Investigation" into "Cheonan" Case Exposed Again
Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Media Verification Committee for Probe into the Truth behind the Case of Warship "Cheonan", made up of three media organizations including the Journalist Association, on November 3 clarified again that the warship was not sunken by a torpedo attack.
					 The organization referred to the fact that a shell covered with flower-like white substance was discovered from the inside of the torpedo propelling body produced by the authorities as overwhelming evidence when announcing the results of the investigation into the "Cheonan" case. This indicates the propelling body has nothing to do with the case, it added.
					
					 The white substance was formed in the long floating of substance in solid state in the water, the organization held, adding that this proves the shell existed inside the propelling body even before the formation of the substance.
					
					 Had this white substance been what was adsorbed in the course of explosion, it could not have remained in such flower shape on the shell, the organization asserted.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion artistica del CRTC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion artistica del CRTC
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, presencio la funcion del grupo artistico de los empleados del Comite de Radio y Television de Corea dedicada al 65o aniversario de la fundacion de esta entidad.
					  En la escena se presentaron las piezas de diferentes generos, tales como la poesia y narracion "Los 3 Generales del monte Paektu y la radio de Corea", el cuarteto mixto y coro "Gloria al gran partido nuestro", el sexteto femenino "Si nuestro Partido-Madre lo desea", el drama tomado de una historia real "Chon Pok y Man Kil: 'Mecha'", el canto homofono de tambor "Estamos en la ofensiva general" y la charla humoristica "Toltoli y Samnyo: 'Enfoquemos'", el coro "Si Corea decide, lo cumple".
					
					  A traves de la funcion, los ejecutantes cantaron en tono patetico de la trayectoria orgullosa de 65 anos recorrida por la radio y television del Juche de nuestro pais bajo la direccion del partido y el Lider y el gran orgullo y aspecto feliz de ellos que viven como dignos trabajadores de la prensa en el regazo afectuoso del Dirigente.
					
					  Igualmente, demostraron bien la ferrea conviccion y voluntad de los funcionarios del comite mencionado de vivir y luchar como acompanantes eternos del PTC compartiendo hasta el final el mismo destino con este partido.
					
					  El Dirigente felicito los exitos de la funcion luego de responder con la mano alzada a las aclamaciones de los ejecutantes y espectadores.
					
					  Se puso muy satisfecho de que los empleados del CRTC hayan ofrecido esta funcion excelente, en que aletea el espiritu de la epoca con las piezas de mucho valor cognoscitivo y educativo que reflejan de manera verosimil su vida, al asimilar la cultura de los militares creada en la epoca del Songun. Y volvio a apreciar los exitos de la funcion y expreso agradecimiento a ellos.
					
					  Ahora nuestros publicistas, bien conscientes de su mision y deber asumidos ante la epoca y la revolucion, propagan en tono altisonante la idea y la politica de Songun del PTC y apoyan fielmente la direccion del PTC, destaco y anadio que un gran orgullo de nuestro partido es contar con tales fidedignos hombres de prensa.
					
					  Reconocio los exitos logrados anteriormente por los funcionarios del CRTC recordando que ellos defendieron en lo politico e ideologico al partido y al Lider tomando firmemente la pluma y el microfono de la revolucion tanto en los dias gloriosos como en los de severas pruebas y estimularon mucho al ejercito y el pueblo coreanos levantados para cumplir la causa de construccion de una gran potencia prospera.
					
					   Hoy en dia, tiempo historico en que se produce un cambio decisivo en el cumplimiento de la causa revolucionaria del Juche y la de construccion de una gran potencia prospera socialista, todo el pais se agitara de gran auge revolucionario y se pondra de plano manifiesto el poderio espiritual de todos los militares y civiles cuando hierva la prensa y se encienda el corazon de los periodistas y publicistas, recalco y presento las tareas programaticas que incumben a ellos.
					
					  Acompanaron al Dirigente en esta ocasion Kim Ki Nam y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del Buro Politico (BP) y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, y los comandantes del ejercito.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il ve funcion de grupo de propaganda artistica juvenil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il ve funcion de grupo de propaganda artistica juvenil
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, presencio la funcion del Grupo Central de Propaganda Artistica Juvenil.
					　Los ejecutantes pusieron en la escena varias piezas de diversas formas como la recitacion de poesia "Union de la Juventud de los Tres Generales del monte Paektu", el coro mixto "Gloria al gran partido nuestro", el duo mixto "Adelante los jovenes siguiendo al Partido", la charla comica y dramatica "No hay fin", el duo femenino y pangchang "Fascinacion y veneracion", el coro y narracion "El camino que recorremos con gusto", la danza "Es bueno nuestro estilo", el coro pequeno "Si Corea decide, lo cumple", etc.
					
					　A traves de la funcion, los ejecutantes alabaron con orgullo la relevante trayectoria de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, que ha avanzado a pasos firmes solo por la senda de victoria y gloria bajo la guia del partido y el lider, y los meritos de lucha de los jovenes quienes cumplen el papel vanguardista en la defensa de la patria y en todos los sectores de la construccion socialista. 
					
					　Igualmente, mostraron bien la ferrea conviccion y voluntad de 5 millones de vanguardias juveniles de llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada en las selvas del Paektu y hacerse bombas y balas para defender a costa de la vida al General Kim Jong Il.
					
					　El Dirigente respondio cordialmente a las aclamaciones entusiastas de los ejecutantes y los espectadores y felicito el exito de la funcion. 
					
					　Muy satisfecho de que los miembros del Grupo Central de Propaganda Artistica Juvenil hayan ofrecido la excelente funcion de alto nivel ideo-artistico, al crear las obras de gran valor cognoscitivo y educativo convenientes a las peculiaridades de los jovenes, el evaluo de alto el exito de la funcion y les dio su agradecimiento. 
					
					　Los jovenes, que son destacamento de combate mas vigoroso, desempenan el rol de protagonista en la defensa de la patria y en la construccion socialista, gracias a lo cual se lleva adelante la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada por los martires antecesores, dijo el Dirigente y agrego que un gran orgullo de nuestro partido es tener ese fidedigno contingente juvenil aspirante a la revolucion y a la lucha. 
					
					　El Grupo Central de Propaganda Artistica Juvenil se encarga de una parte del frente ideologico para preparar con mas firmeza a los jovenes, que son nuevas generaciones venideras, como los continuadores de la revolucion infinitamente fieles al partido y la revolucion, afirmo e indico las tareas programaticas que se presentan en la creacion y actividades artisticas. 
					
					　Le acompanaron en ver la funcion Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del Buro Politico (BP) y secretarios del Comite Central del PTC; Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC; Kang Sok Ju, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros; Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN; Choe Ryong Hae, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC; Ri Yong Chol, primer secretario del CC de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung; y otros funcionarios directivos del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Fallecio Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Fallecio Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ATCC) -- A las 10 y media del 6 de noviembre del 99 (2010) de Era Juche, fallecio a los 82 anos de edad a causa de su larga enfermedad cardiaca el vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Jo Myong Rok, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea (PTC), primer vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional (CDN) y diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (RPDC).
					　Nacido el 12 de julio del 17 (1928) de la Era Juche en una familia pobre del distrito de Yonsa de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, Jo ha sido fiel companero revolucionario del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y destacado activista de nuestro partido, Estado y ejercito que dedico toda su vida a la sagrada lucha por la libertad y la independencia de la patria y la victoria de la causa socialista.
					
					　Despues de la liberacion de la patria, Jo crecio en el regazo del partido y el lider como competente funcionario politico-militar y trabajo durante largo tiempo en los puestos importantes del partido, el Estado y el ejercito.
					
					　Durante la enconada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria contra la agresion armada del imperialismo norteamericano, Jo combatio valientemente como piloto del EPC por la victoria de la guerra.
					
					　Despues de la guerra, trabajo activamente por el fortalecimiento de las fuerzas aereas ocupando sucesivamente varios cargos como el jefe de batallon, regimiento y division de una unidad de aviacion del EPC y jefe del Estado Mayor de la comandancia de las fuerzas aereas y comandante de las mismas.
					
					　Ocupando los puestos responsables de jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC desde octubre del 84 (1995) de la Era Juche y de primer vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC desde septiembre del 87 (1998) de la Era Juche, Jo trabajo con dinamismo para materializar cabalmente las autoctonas lineas militares de nuestro partido y asegurar con las invencibles fuerzas armadas la construccion de la gran potencia prospera y la victoria de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					　El fue elegido como miembro suplente del CC del PTC en noviembre del 64 (1975) de la Era Juche; como miembro del CC y de la Comision Militar Central del PTC en octubre del 69 (1980) de la Era Juche; como miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC en septiembre del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche.
					
					　Trabajo de diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema desde la sexta legislatura de este organo sesionada en noviembre del 66 (1977) de la Era Juche.
					
					　En reconocimiento de sus excepcionales meritos realizados por el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo, se le fueron otorgadas numerosas ordenes y medallas, incluyendo la Orden Kim Il Sung, maxima distincion de la RPDC, el titulo de Heroe de la RPDC y del Trabajo, la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase y la Orden Libertad e Independencia de primera clase.
					
					　Ademas recibio el titulo de vicemariscal del EPC en octubre del 84 (1995) de la Era Juche.
					
					　El dia 6, fue publicada la esquela mortuoria a nombre comun del CC y la Comision Militar Central del PTC, el CDN y el Presidium de la APS de la RPDC.
					
					　La nota senala que el deceso de Jo es una gran perdida para nuestro partido, ejercito y pueblo que luchan por la victoria de la causa de construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista y adelantar la reunificacion independiente de la patria.
					
					　Destaca que aunque el fallecio, sus hazanas acumuladas ante el partido, la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo seran eternas junto con el avance victorioso de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					　El mismo dia, el CC y la CMC del PTC, el CDN y el Presidium de la APS de la RPDC dieron a conocer que los funerales de Jo se realizaran con honores del Estado, y compusieron la comision funeraria estatal presidida por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il e integrada por Kim Jong Un y otros 169 miembros.
					
					　Esta comision informo que el feretro del difunto reposa en la Casa Central de Obreros y saldra de este lugar a las 9 del dia 10 y acogera a los visitantes desde las 10 del dia 8 hasta las 18 del dia 9.
